intro: Bunium mauritanicum var. perotii, commonly known as the Mauritania fennel, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its feathery, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The seeds are small and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution across its native range.
